cards.name: Angel of Retribution
cards.text: Flying, first strike
cards.flavor: Bitter vengeance never glowed so bright nor sang so sweet.
cards.original_text: Flying, first strike

cards.name: Aven Trooper
cards.text:
Flying
{2}{W}, Discard a card: Aven Trooper gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The very skies seethe with the aven's hatred for the Cabal.
cards.original_text:
Flying
{2}{W}, Discard a card from your hand: Aven Trooper gets +1/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Cleansing Meditation
cards.text:
Destroy all enchantments.
Threshold — If seven or more cards are in your graveyard, instead destroy all enchantments, then return all cards in your graveyard destroyed this way to the battlefield.
cards.original_text:
Destroy all enchantments.
Threshold Instead destroy all enchantments, then return to play all cards in your graveyard destroyed this way. (You have threshold if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

rulings.text: Auras returning to the battlefield are placed on any legal permanent of your choice. Doing this does not target the permanent. If there is no legal permanent for an Aura, it remains in the graveyard.

Auras returning to the battlefield can only enchant something that was already on the battlefield. An Enchant Enchantment returning to the battlefield can't be placed on an enchantment that is also in the process of returning to the battlefield.

cards.name: Equal Treatment
cards.text:
If any source would deal 1 or more damage to a permanent or player this turn, it deals 2 damage to that permanent or player instead.
Draw a card.
cards.original_text:
If any source would deal 1 or more damage to a creature or player this turn, it deals 2 damage to that creature or player instead.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Floating Shield
cards.text:
Enchant creature
As Floating Shield enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Enchanted creature has protection from the chosen color. This effect doesn't remove Floating Shield.
Sacrifice Floating Shield: Target creature gains protection from the chosen color until end of turn.
cards.original_text:
As Floating Shield comes into play, choose a color.
Enchanted creature has protection from the chosen color. This effect doesn't remove Floating Shield.
Sacrifice Floating Shield: Target creature gains protection from the chosen color until end of turn.

cards.name: Frantic Purification
cards.text:
Destroy target enchantment.
Madness {W} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
cards.flavor: By definition, madness ends in one of two ways: clarity . . . or death.
cards.original_text:
Destroy target enchantment.
Madness {W} (You may play this card for its madness cost at the time you discard it from your hand.)

cards.name: Hypochondria
cards.text:
{W}, Discard a card: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
{W}, Sacrifice Hypochondria: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.original_text:
{W}, Discard a card from your hand: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
{W}, Sacrifice Hypochondria: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Major Teroh
cards.text:
Flying
{3}{W}{W}, Sacrifice Major Teroh: Exile all black creatures.
cards.flavor: "I am the holy wind that shall avenge the Cabal's victims."
cards.original_text:
Flying
{3}{W}{W}, Sacrifice Major Teroh: Remove all black creatures from the game.

cards.name: Militant Monk
cards.text:
Vigilance
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.original_text:
Attacking doesn't cause Militant Monk to tap.
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Morningtide
cards.text: Exile all cards from all graveyards.
cards.flavor:
"The spirits of the righteous shall rise into the sky. Even dirtwalkers will fly like aven."
—Major Teroh
cards.original_text: Remove all cards in all graveyards from the game.

cards.name: Mystic Familiar
cards.text:
Flying
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Mystic Familiar gets +1/+1 and has protection from black.
cards.flavor: They soar, and the mystics follow.
cards.original_text:
Flying
Threshold Mystic Familiar gets +1/+1 and has protection from black. (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Pay No Heed
cards.text: Prevent all damage a source of your choice would deal this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Inhale life. Exhale pain."
—Mystic elder
cards.original_text: Prevent all damage a source of your choice would deal this turn.

rulings.text: Pay No Heed doesn't target anything. You can choose a source with hexproof, for example. You choose the damage source as Pay No Heed resolves.
If the chosen source is a permanent spell, damage dealt later in the turn by the permanent it becomes will also be prevented.

cards.name: Possessed Nomad
cards.text:
Vigilance
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Possessed Nomad gets +1/+1, is black, and has "{2}{B}, {T}: Destroy target white creature."
cards.original_text:
Attacking doesn't cause Possessed Nomad to tap.
Threshold Possessed Nomad gets +1/+1, is black, and has "{2}{B}, {T}: Destroy target white creature." (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Reborn Hero
cards.text:
Vigilance
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Reborn Hero has "When Reborn Hero dies, you may pay {W}{W}. If you do, return Reborn Hero to the battlefield under your control."
cards.original_text:
Attacking doesn't cause Reborn Hero to tap.
Threshold When Reborn Hero is put into a graveyard from play, you may pay {W}{W}. If you do, return Reborn Hero to play under your control. (You have threshold if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

rulings.text: You must already have seven or more cards in your graveyard before Reborn Hero is put into the graveyard in order for its Threshold ability to trigger; you don't include Reborn Hero itself in the count.

cards.name: Spirit Flare
cards.text:
Tap target untapped creature you control. If you do, it deals damage equal to its power to target attacking or blocking creature an opponent controls.
Flashback—{1}{W}, Pay 3 life. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.original_text:
Tap target untapped creature you control. If you do, it deals damage equal to its power to target attacking or blocking creature an opponent controls.
Flashback—{1}{W}, Pay 3 life. (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

rulings.text: If either target is illegal when the spell resolves, it will do no damage.

cards.name: Stern Judge
cards.text: {T}: Each player loses 1 life for each Swamp they control.
cards.flavor: "How to punish the guilty is up to the Ancestor. Deciding who merits such punishment is up to me."
cards.original_text: {T}: Each player loses 1 life for each swamp he or she controls.

cards.name: Strength of Isolation
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2 and has protection from black.
Madness {W} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
cards.flavor: Don't mistake isolation for safety.
cards.original_text:
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2 and has protection from black.
Madness {W} (You may play this card for its madness cost at the time you discard it from your hand.)

cards.name: Teroh's Faithful
cards.text: When Teroh's Faithful enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
cards.flavor: The light of reason follows them even into battle.
cards.original_text: When Teroh's Faithful comes into play, you gain 4 life.

cards.name: Teroh's Vanguard
cards.text:
Flash
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Teroh's Vanguard has "When Teroh's Vanguard enters the battlefield, creatures you control gain protection from black until end of turn."
cards.original_text:
You may play Teroh's Vanguard any time you could play an instant.
Threshold When Teroh's Vanguard comes into play, creatures you control gain protection from black until end of turn. (You have threshold if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Transcendence
cards.text:
You don't lose the game for having 0 or less life.
When you have 20 or more life, you lose the game.
Whenever you lose life, you gain 2 life for each 1 life you lost. (Damage dealt to you causes you to lose life.)
cards.original_text:
You don't lose the game for having 0 or less life.
When you have 20 or more life, you lose the game.
Whenever you lose life, you gain 2 life for each 1 life you lost. (Damage dealt to you causes you to lose life.)

rulings.text: If your life total is 20 or more and you control an effect that states "you can't lose the game", then an infinite loop is formed. If neither player wants to end the loop by removing one of these two cards from the battlefield, the game ends in a draw.

cards.name: Vengeful Dreams
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard X cards.
Exile X target attacking creatures.
cards.flavor: Teroh dreams of his enemies' doom.
cards.original_text:
As an additional cost to play Vengeful Dreams, discard X cards from your hand.
Remove X target attacking creatures from the game.

cards.name: Alter Reality
cards.text:
Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
Flashback {1}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.original_text:
Change the text of target permanent or spell by replacing all instances of one color word with another. (This effect doesn't end at end of turn.)
Flashback {1}{U} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

rulings.text: Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
It can't change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
You choose the words to change on resolution.

Changing the text of a spell will not allow you to change the targets of the spell because the targets were chosen when the spell was cast. The text change will (probably) cause it to be countered since the targets will be illegal.
If you change the text of a spell which is to become a permanent, the permanent will retain the text change until the effect wears off.

cards.name: Ambassador Laquatus
cards.text: {3}: Target player puts the top three cards of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"He smiles with poisoned lips."
—Empress Llawan
cards.original_text: {3}: Target player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Aquamoeba
cards.text: Discard a card: Switch Aquamoeba's power and toughness until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Some tides need no moon.
cards.original_text: Discard a card from your hand: Switch Aquamoeba's power and toughness until end of turn.

rulings.text: Effects that switch power and toughness apply after all other effects that change power and/or toughness, regardless of which effect was created first.
Switching a creature's power and toughness twice (or any even number of times) effectively returns the creature to the power and toughness it had before any switches.

cards.name: Balshan Collaborator
cards.text:
Flying
{B}: Balshan Collaborator gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Power, gold, crackers—every bird has its price."
—Chainer, dementia master
cards.original_text:
Flying
{B}: Balshan Collaborator gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Breakthrough
cards.text: Draw four cards, then choose X cards in your hand and discard the rest.
cards.flavor: The ideas came flooding in so fast that they couldn't all be contained.
cards.original_text: Draw four cards, then choose X cards in your hand and discard the rest from it.

cards.name: Cephalid Aristocrat
cards.text: Whenever Cephalid Aristocrat becomes the target of a spell or ability, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: It's easy to tell the difference between the devious cephalids and the trustworthy ones. The trustworthy ones are dead.
cards.original_text: Whenever Cephalid Aristocrat becomes the target of a spell or ability, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.

cards.name: Cephalid Illusionist
cards.text:
Whenever Cephalid Illusionist becomes the target of a spell or ability, put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard.
{2}{U}, {T}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by target creature you control this turn.
cards.original_text:
Whenever Cephalid Illusionist becomes the target of a spell or ability, put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard.
{2}{U}, {T}: This turn prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by target creature you control.

cards.name: Cephalid Sage
cards.text: Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Cephalid Sage has "When Cephalid Sage enters the battlefield, draw three cards, then discard two cards."
cards.original_text: Threshold When Cephalid Sage comes into play, draw three cards, then discard two cards from your hand. (You have threshold if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

rulings.text: You draw three cards and discard two cards all while Cephalid Sage's ability is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

If you don't have enough cards in your graveyard at the moment Cephalid Sage enters the battlefield, its threshold ability won't trigger. If the number of cards in your graveyard changes and Cephalid Sage loses the ability once it has triggered, the ability will still resolve.

cards.name: Cephalid Snitch
cards.text: Sacrifice Cephalid Snitch: Target creature loses protection from black until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The cautious are wary of their enemies. The wise are also wary of their friends.
cards.original_text: Sacrifice Cephalid Snitch: Target creature loses protection from black until end of turn.

cards.name: Cephalid Vandal
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a shred counter on Cephalid Vandal. Then put the top card of your library into your graveyard for each shred counter on Cephalid Vandal.
cards.original_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a shred counter on Cephalid Vandal. Then put the top card of your library into your graveyard for each shred counter on Cephalid Vandal.

cards.name: Churning Eddy
cards.text: Return target creature and target land to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor:
"Magic is like the tide—both ebb, both flow, and both serve my whims."
—Empress Llawan
cards.original_text: Return target creature and target land to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Circular Logic
cards.text:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each card in your graveyard.
Madness {U} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
cards.original_text:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each card in your graveyard.
Madness {U} (You may play this card for its madness cost at the time you discard it from your hand.)

cards.name: Compulsion
cards.text:
{1}{U}, Discard a card: Draw a card.
{1}{U}, Sacrifice Compulsion: Draw a card.
cards.original_text:
{1}{U}, Discard a card from your hand: Draw a card. 
{1}{U}, Sacrifice Compulsion: Draw a card.

cards.name: Coral Net
cards.text:
Enchant green or white creature
Enchanted creature has "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this creature unless you discard a card."
cards.original_text:
Coral Net can enchant only a green or white creature.
Enchanted creature has "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this creature unless you discard a card from your hand."

cards.name: Deep Analysis
cards.text:
Target player draws two cards.
Flashback—{1}{U}, Pay 3 life. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: "The specimen seems to be broken."
cards.original_text:
Target player draws two cards.
Flashback—{1}{U}, Pay 3 life. (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: False Memories
cards.text: Put the top seven cards of your library into your graveyard. At the beginning of the next end step, exile seven cards from your graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"My enemies will forget everything but their anguish."
—Ambassador Laquatus
cards.original_text: Put the top seven cards of your library into your graveyard. At end of turn, remove seven cards in your graveyard from the game.

cards.name: Ghostly Wings
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has flying.
Discard a card: Return enchanted creature to its owner's hand.
cards.original_text:
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has flying.
Discard a card from your hand: Return enchanted creature to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: You control Ghostly Wings even while it enchants an opponent's creature. Only you can activate the last ability of Ghostly Wings.
After the last ability of Ghostly Wings resolves, it will be an Aura on the battlefield that isn't attached to a creature and will immediately be put into its owner's graveyard.

If Ghostly Wings leaves the battlefield before its activated ability resolves, the creature that was enchanted immediately before Ghostly Wings left is the one that will be returned to its owner's hand, if it's still on the battlefield.
You can activate the last ability multiple times to discard multiple cards. Only the first ability to resolve will have any effect.

cards.name: Hydromorph Guardian
cards.text: {U}, Sacrifice Hydromorph Guardian: Counter target spell that targets a creature you control.
cards.flavor: In front of every strong leader is a pool of loyal bodyguards.
cards.original_text: {U}, Sacrifice Hydromorph Guardian: Counter target spell that targets one or more creatures you control.

cards.name: Hydromorph Gull
cards.text:
Flying
{U}, Sacrifice Hydromorph Gull: Counter target spell that targets a creature you control.
cards.flavor:
"The only kind of water that should fly through the air is rain."
—Kamahl, pit fighter
cards.original_text:
Flying
{U}, Sacrifice Hydromorph Gull: Counter target spell that targets one or more creatures you control.

cards.name: Liquify
cards.text: Counter target spell with converted mana cost 3 or less. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.
cards.original_text: Counter target spell with converted mana cost 3 or less. If it's countered this way, remove it from the game instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Llawan, Cephalid Empress
cards.text:
When Llawan, Cephalid Empress enters the battlefield, return all blue creatures your opponents control to their owners' hands.
Your opponents can't cast blue creature spells.
cards.original_text:
When Llawan, Cephalid Empress comes into play, return all blue creatures your opponents control to their owners' hands.
Your opponents can't play blue creature spells.

cards.name: Obsessive Search
cards.text:
Draw a card.
Madness {U} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
cards.flavor: The question strained his sanity. The answer snapped it in half.
cards.original_text:
Draw a card.
Madness {U} (You may play this card for its madness cost at the time you discard it from your hand.)

cards.name: Plagiarize
cards.text: Until end of turn, if target player would draw a card, instead that player skips that draw and you draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Are you thinking what I'm thinking?"
cards.original_text: Until end of turn, if target player would draw a card, instead that player skips that draw and you draw a card.

rulings.text: If you target yourself, this spell has no useful effect. It will not cause an infinite loop since a replacement effect can't modify the same event more than once. This effect will not modify the draw that it has you perform.
You draw the card from your library as normal, not from your opponent's library.

If you and your opponent each cast Plagiarize on each other during the same turn, the two spells effectively cancel each other out. You will draw cards when you normally would and so will your opponent.

If you target a player whose library is empty, any effect or turn-based action that would cause that player to draw a card will cause you to draw a card instead. It doesn't matter that the other player would be unable to draw.

cards.name: Possessed Aven
cards.text:
Flying
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Possessed Aven gets +1/+1, is black, and has "{2}{B}, {T}: Destroy target blue creature."
cards.original_text:
Flying
Threshold Possessed Aven gets +1/+1, is black, and has "{2}{B}, {T}: Destroy target blue creature." (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Retraced Image
cards.text: Reveal a card in your hand, then put that card onto the battlefield if it has the same name as a permanent.
cards.flavor: An army from a soldier, a flock from a bird, a school from a fish . . . a profit from an atrocity.
cards.original_text: Reveal a card in your hand, then put that card into play if it has the same name as a permanent in play.

cards.name: Skywing Aven
cards.text:
Flying
Discard a card: Return Skywing Aven to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: "I am as the wind that bears me: harsh yet gentle, fleeting yet ever-present. Together we fly beyond imagination."
cards.original_text:
Flying
Discard a card from your hand: Return Skywing Aven to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Stupefying Touch
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Stupefying Touch enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature's activated abilities can't be activated.
cards.flavor: Just because your eyes are open doesn't mean you're awake.
cards.original_text:
When Stupefying Touch comes into play, draw a card.
Enchanted creature's activated abilities can't be played.

rulings.text: Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.
Unlike many similar abilities, Stupefying Touch's last ability stops mana abilities from being activated.

cards.name: Turbulent Dreams
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard X cards.
Return X target nonland permanents to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor: Laquatus dreams of seizing control.
cards.original_text:
As an additional cost to play Turbulent Dreams, discard X cards from your hand.
Return X target nonland permanents to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Boneshard Slasher
cards.text:
Flying
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Boneshard Slasher gets +2/+2 and has "When Boneshard Slasher becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it."
cards.original_text:
Flying
Threshold Boneshard Slasher gets +2/+2 and has "When Boneshard Slasher becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it." (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Cabal Ritual
cards.text:
Add {B}{B}{B}.
Threshold — Add {B}{B}{B}{B}{B} instead if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Each syllable chills your veins. Each word rattles your mind."
—Cabal Patriarch
cards.original_text:
Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
Threshold Instead add {B}{B}{B}{B}{B} to your mana pool. (You have threshold if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Cabal Surgeon
cards.text: {2}{B}{B}, {T}, Exile two cards from your graveyard: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: "Clerics give up when their patients die. Can I help it if I'm more compassionate?"
cards.original_text: {2}{B}{B}, {T}, Remove two cards in your graveyard from the game: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Cabal Torturer
cards.text:
{B}, {T}: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Threshold — {3}{B}{B}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.original_text:
{B}, {T}: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Threshold {3}{B}{B}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn. (Play this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Carrion Rats
cards.text: Whenever Carrion Rats attacks or blocks, any player may exile a card from their graveyard. If a player does, Carrion Rats assigns no combat damage this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Just what I need—more competition."
—Cabal grave robber
cards.original_text: Whenever Carrion Rats attacks or blocks, any player may remove a card in his or her graveyard from the game. If a player does, Carrion Rats deals no combat damage this turn.

cards.name: Carrion Wurm
cards.text: Whenever Carrion Wurm attacks or blocks, any player may exile three cards from their graveyard. If a player does, Carrion Wurm assigns no combat damage this turn.
cards.flavor: Since it eats only carrion, sometimes it needs to make some from scratch.
cards.original_text: Whenever Carrion Wurm attacks or blocks, any player may remove three cards in his or her graveyard from the game. If a player does, Carrion Wurm deals no combat damage this turn.

cards.name: Chainer, Dementia Master
cards.text:
Nightmare creatures get +1/+1.
{B}{B}{B}, Pay 3 life: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. That creature is black and is a Nightmare in addition to its other creature types.
When Chainer, Dementia Master leaves the battlefield, exile all Nightmares.
cards.original_text:
All Nightmares get +1/+1.
{B}{B}{B}, Pay 3 life: Put target creature card from a graveyard into play under your control. That creature is black and is a Nightmare in addition to its creature types.
When Chainer, Dementia Master leaves play, remove all Nightmares from the game.

cards.name: Chainer's Edict
cards.text:
Target player sacrifices a creature.
Flashback {5}{B}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: The pits have their own form of mercy.
cards.original_text:
Target player sacrifices a creature.
Flashback {5}{B}{B} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Crippling Fatigue
cards.text:
Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
Flashback—{1}{B}, Pay 3 life. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.original_text:
Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
Flashback—{1}{B}, Pay 3 life. (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Dawn of the Dead
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 1 life.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature gains haste until end of turn. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.original_text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 1 life.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to play. That creature gains haste until end of turn. Remove it from the game at end of turn.

rulings.text: The creature is only exiled if it is still on the battlefield at the beginning of the end step.

If the creature leaves the battlefield, but returns to the battlefield before the triggered ability resolves, you won't exile it. This is because it is treated as a different object than the one to which the ability refers.

cards.name: Faceless Butcher
cards.text:
When Faceless Butcher enters the battlefield, exile target creature other than Faceless Butcher.
When Faceless Butcher leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
cards.original_text:
When Faceless Butcher comes into play, remove target creature other than Faceless Butcher from the game.
When Faceless Butcher leaves play, return the removed card to play under its owner's control.

rulings.text: Three Faceless Butchers cast in succession with no other creatures on the battlefield will result in an infinite loop and the game will be a draw, unless a player somehow interrupts the loop.

cards.name: Gloomdrifter
cards.text:
Flying
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Gloomdrifter has "When Gloomdrifter enters the battlefield, nonblack creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn."
cards.original_text:
Flying
Threshold When Gloomdrifter comes into play, nonblack creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn. (You have threshold if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Gravegouger
cards.text:

When Gravegouger leaves the battlefield, return the exiled cards to their owner's graveyard.
cards.original_text:

When Gravegouger leaves play, return the removed cards to their owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Grotesque Hybrid

cards.name: Hypnox

Flying

cards.original_text:
Flying

rulings.text: If a creature (such as Clone) enters the battlefield as a copy of this creature, the copy's "enters-the-battlefield" ability will still trigger as long as you cast that creature spell from your hand.

cards.name: Ichorid
cards.text:
Haste
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ichorid.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Ichorid is in your graveyard, you may exile a black creature card other than Ichorid from your graveyard. If you do, return Ichorid to the battlefield.
cards.original_text:
Haste
At end of turn, sacrifice Ichorid.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Ichorid is in your graveyard, you may remove a black creature card in your graveyard other than Ichorid from the game. If you do, return Ichorid to play.

rulings.text: If multiple Ichorids are in your graveyard, you can't exile the same creature card to return each of them to the battlefield.
If one Ichorid's ability exiles another, the exiled Ichorid's ability can't return it to the battlefield.

rulings.text: As Laquatus's Champion's second ability resolves, the player who gains 6 life is the player who was the target of the first ability (or, if that ability is still on the stack, the player who is its target).

rulings.text: If Mesmeric Fiend leaves the battlefield before its first ability has resolved, its second ability will trigger and do nothing. Then its first ability will resolve and exile a nonland card from the target opponent's hand indefinitely.

cards.name: Mortal Combat
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if twenty or more creature cards are in your graveyard, you win the game.
cards.flavor: The crowd roared, the fighters bled, and the dead piled high in the pits. Only the Cabal could win.
cards.original_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if twenty or more creature cards are in your graveyard, you win the game.

rulings.text: If you don't have twenty or more creature cards in your graveyard by the time your upkeep starts, the ability won't trigger that turn.

Mortal Combat's ability has an "intervening 'if' clause," so the condition is checked again when the triggered ability resolves. If you don't still have twenty creature cards in your graveyard, the ability does nothing.

cards.flavor: Empires rise and fall, but evil is eternal.

rulings.text: If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter.

Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.
If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

cards.name: Fiery Temper
cards.text:
Fiery Temper deals 3 damage to any target.
Madness {R} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
cards.original_text:
Fiery Temper deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
Madness {R} (You may play this card for its madness cost at the time you discard it from your hand.)

rulings.text: Cards are discarded in a Magic game only from a player's hand. Effects that put cards from a player's library into that player's graveyard do not cause those cards to be discarded.

A spell cast for its madness cost is put onto the stack like any other spell. It can be countered, copied, and so on. As it resolves, it's put onto the battlefield if it's a permanent card or into its owner's graveyard if it's an instant or sorcery card.
Casting a spell for its madness cost doesn't change its mana cost or its converted mana cost. You just pay the madness cost instead.
Effects that cause you to pay more or less for a spell will cause you to pay that much more or less for its madness cost, too.

Madness works independently of why you're discarding the card. You could discard it to pay a cost, because a spell or ability tells you to, or even because you have too many cards in your hand at the end of your turn. You can't discard a card with madness just because you want to, though.
When you cast a card with madness, it was still discarded. If it was discarded to pay a cost, that cost is still paid. Abilities that trigger when a card is discarded will still trigger.
If you choose not to cast a card with madness when the madness triggered ability resolves, it's put into your graveyard. You don't get another chance to cast it later.

If you discard a card with madness to pay the cost of a spell or activated ability, that card's madness trigger (and the spell that card becomes, if you choose to cast it) will resolve before the spell or ability the discard paid for.

If you discard a card with madness while resolving a spell or ability, it moves immediately to exile. Continue resolving that spell or ability—the card is not in your graveyard at this time. Its madness trigger will be placed onto the stack once that spell or ability has completely resolved.

rulings.text: If this card's ability is activated by one player, then another player takes control of it on the same turn, the second player can't activate its ability that turn.

cards.name: Centaur Chieftain
cards.text:
Haste
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Centaur Chieftain has "When Centaur Chieftain enters the battlefield, creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain trample until end of turn."
cards.original_text:
Haste
Threshold When Centaur Chieftain comes into play, creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain trample until end of turn. (You have threshold if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

rulings.text: All creatures under your control when Centaur Chieftain's triggered ability resolves are affected, including Centaur Chieftain itself. Ones that come under your control or become creatures later in the turn are not.

If you don't have enough cards in your graveyard at the moment Centaur Chieftain enters the battlefield, its threshold ability won't trigger. If the number of cards in your graveyard changes and Centaur Chieftain loses the ability once it has triggered, the ability will still resolve.

cards.original_text:
Search your library for a basic land card and put that card into play tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Gurzigost
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Gurzigost unless you put two cards from your graveyard on the bottom of your library.
{G}{G}, Discard a card: You may have Gurzigost assign its combat damage this turn as though it weren't blocked.
cards.original_text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Gurzigost unless you put two cards from your graveyard on the bottom of your library.
{G}{G}, Discard a card from your hand: You may have Gurzigost deal its combat damage to defending player this turn as though it weren't blocked.

rulings.text: You decide how it will assign its damage at the time the ability resolves. This will be prior to actually assigning combat damage.
If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.
